page.title: 04HAMSEYPLACE FARM AND HOUSE
page.content: Hamseyplace Farm covers an area of{300 {acres.}Until recently it was almost only a{dairy farm.}Now there are not so many cattle as{more crops}are grown, especially{wheat and barley. This is due to the greater control of drainage which has reduced risk of flooding. The barn which was used to house cattle and keep their winter food has become important for storing hay, drying grain and keeping the tractor. The thatched is now replaced by corrugated iron. The farmer now lives in a smaller house in Offham as{12 years ago the {land and 17th century farmhouse were {sold off seperately.}This typical Sussex farmhouse is a tile-hung, timber framed house with stone foundations. The present owners have removed many of the 19th century room divisions added to house servants.
